content:
Normally, Thunderbird would prompt if server is refusing due to incorrect password. All I can think of would be to either manually add the password to Thunderbird, or to remove what is there to allow a prompt. Here goes: - click settings>privacy&security - click saved passwords and then show passwords - highlight the incoming server row and rightclick and select 'edit password'

OR... - from same place, highlight the incoming and outgoing rows and delete.

content:
Do you have more than one user auto deleting mail on fetch using POP3, sharing a pop3 account.

That would cause the error big time. Users can not share a POP mail account and delete messages from the server. These errors are what occurs, especially if someone deletes the mail after the server presents the list of available mail on the initial connection.
creator: MattAuSupport

content:
What list?

Spam/Junk is a mathematical process based on the contents of the message against a locally generated database of text fragments based on your training over time (in my case decades) The learning algorithm uses those fragments as tokens to determine is text is SPAMMY or not, when a preset number is achieved the mail is considered junk/spam. It has nothing at all to do with the from address so there is no "SPAMMERS" address list.
creator: MattAuSupport

content: So having instructed Thunderbird that an email received is Junk, and it will then automatically put future emails into the junk folder, how do I instruct it not do so?
creator: timelliott

content:
Tim Elliott said
So having instructed Thunderbird that an email received is Junk, and it will then automatically put future emails into the junk folder, how do I instruct it not do so?

I think that is something of an overreach, and an issue that support folk have battled with for years. Selecting an email as SPAM does not create some sort of blacklist/block listing on that address.

You decided a single email from a specific address was junk. Given that having done so and knowing that Thunderbird has no regard to the sender in determining a junk status (it does not appear to matter how many time I tell people they still think it matters. I already told you that yet you came back immediately with this idea that the sender is relevant again.) the worst outcome you might see is a slightly higher false positive rate for junk because of your choice has added HAM terms to the SPAM tokens. But in a database with years of other decisions in it the impact will be about zero. The learning part of the filter is known to need around 50 decisions about what is SPAM and another 50 on What is HAM to really start to learn anything because everything in the text is weighted statistically.

You can always reset the overall learning database to a newly installed state, but honestly I would not even consider doing so until I had seen many many false positives that telling Thunderbird were not junk did not fix over time. That is a simple as clicking the reset training data in the account settings. Details of that are included in the document I link below.

There are more details on the junk filtering here https://support.mozilla.org/en-US/kb/thunderbird-and-junk-spam-messages just so I do not appear to be biased to only official documentation, Mozillazine put together an article on junk filtering back in 2004. They have updated it over the years. The last time in 2017. But it provides detailed background information that is as relevant now as it was in 2004, just many of the links and addons no longer exist.
creator: MattAuSupport

I did a quick web search on this error message and noticed there are others out there who report to their email provider and are ignored. In this case, Thunderbird isn't even involved. Message goes from the sender's email server to the TalkTalk server which responds back. They are ignoring the problem.

content:
Could be caused by forced closure! You might even have corrupt files from ending stuff while it is trying to update something.

I would suggest turning Thunderbird to offline mode acknowledging the error and see if it comes good overnight.

You might also try deleting the global index, as that can get corrupted and out of sync with reality. It can also see things that should occur in seconds take many minutes once it is out of sync. https://support.mozilla.org/en-US/kb/rebuilding-global-database

content:
Achiving is within the IMAP account by default. I have no personal experience with apple anything. I refuse to may the extra. However archiving in gmail requires you to leave the mail in the IMAP account. Otherwise archiving does nothing and offers no errors. The server just ignores the command. It would not surprise me at all if Apple did exactly the same thing. Even if you manage to get an archive of gmail somewhere else, gmail still keeps it in the all mail folder, because in their setup that is the archive.

As for the unsubscribe, that sounds like the process of deleting the archived mail is still in progress, (how many thousands of mails are in the queue? That would prevent Thunderbird from accessing other folders when it was to get mail as all available connections would already be in use trying to sync the mass deletion. Showing only the basic inbox and things like deleted is a classic sign of connectivity issues with IMAP accounts.

If you have an apple phone or tablet also connected to that mail, turn them off (overnight perhaps) and that will help the backlog as they have no connection limiting and each will prevent connection from other devices while they do their own sync.
creator: MattAuSupport

content:
This isn't anything with iCloud, or a paid iCloud account (which I don't have).

Okay, trying this again...

In TB, there's an extension called AutoarchiveReloaded, which is responsible archiving mail in my accounts. It works across any mail account from which it can tell TB to move an email from a mail account to a destination folder within TB (which happens to be hardcoded to Local Folders). Looking at the log it produces in the error console, there are no indications this extension is malfunctioning. All archiving is happening as it should to Local Folders.

Moving along...

The archiving isn't the real issue here. It's an annoyance that I can diagnose later. The REAL issue is when deleting a folder in an IMAP account (which just so happens to be an iCloud account, but could be ANY IMAP account), TB unsubscribes from almost EVERY folder on that account (as stated before).

I need to know what's going on and why this is happening. Again, the real annoyance is having to resubscribe to all of my IMAP folders after deleting a folder from that mail account. Is this a bug? Is it a setting somewhere that is set and I need to get into the console or about:config (if that's available) to fix?

There are no "thousands of emails" in the equation here. And the external archiving has been working just fine for ALL of my accounts up until recently (within the last month or so). All it does is copy the email in question from the target account to a local folder, then deletes the email from the target account to free space. No archiving is to be done, nor is it being done by the extension, in the target mail account. So the comment about the email accounts handling archiving is actually incorrect in this case, and as it's setup before I started using AutoarchiveReloaded, they weren't even archiving to their own archive folders to begin with. I never set that up as it wasn't needed.

There were a ton of assumptions made in that post. That bothers me as an IT professional having done 18+ years on help desk and currently almost 7 in a sys admin role. I know when I know nothing, and know to ask for help. I also know to ask questions to fill in my gaps of knowledge concerning a customer's config before making suggestions. Please feel free to ask questions if you're not sure what I'm doing or how I'm set up. I'll offer up as much info as I can, as I know trying to tech an issue in the dark is frustrating.

All I'm asking for is help figuring this out. And in return I'm willing to spill all of the beans on how I'm doing what I'm doing if that'll help me fix this (or at least change how things are running).
creator: netracerx

content:
It sounds a lot to me like your bank is using a unicode font in the email and your apple product is converting that to some other non unicode font in the copy and paste.

The question marks arise when the font being used does not have a corresponding character for the underlying character number. It is becoming increasingly so that large institutions and corporations have a "corporate livery" they include in emails, including downloadable web fonts. Of course apple does not have the same fonts even as Windows, so it may be your bank has not even tested their email on apple desktops/Laptops, it really only represents a very small percentage of any market (about 7-8% worldwide), and how many of their Apple using customers copy and paste the email content anywhere to report it as a problem?

content:
contactus7 said
We have verified it is nothing on our sever, as we can login directly on our server webmail service, and on other browser based email logins (gmail). We have verified server settings, port numbers, etc.

I think you have not actually demonstrated anything with your test of web mail. One is a web page, and your issue is with mail.

Personally I think you answered your own question'

It is only happening with one inbox, it's a general inbox that multiple (5-6) users access. What's going on here?

IMAP servers have a limit to the number of concurrent logins that they will support. Generally Thunderbird will use up to 5, apple mail on an iphone will just keep connecting until it is refused. These multiple connections make things happen faster and allow for say an expunge on one folder while message headers are retrieved for another folder and finally a message is displayed because you selected it.

Thunderbird has controls on the number of connections for each account in the advanced button in server settings for the account. But I think your issue is actually more involved. It maybe that the total connections for a single rackspace mail account is 25 (your stated 5 users at Thunderbird's default 5 connections.) This means you will have to reduce the connections per user to stay within the limit, but as you decrease the number of connections things slow down. Then if you get a sixth user then the whole issue come up again, and again for a seventh. I suggest oyu determine exactly what server limit you are working within.
creator: MattAuSupport

Thank you for the answer. However, we've been using this mailbox the same way for several years. In fact, the number of users has decreased from 7-8 to 5-6. Not all users are actively using the inbox on Thunderbird, but do have it up in the background. We will try to find out how many total connections a single rackspace mail account can handle...though as stated above, we've had more users in the past.

Also, this morning, one of our users got the prompt first thing in the morning, at which time only two people were actively using Thunderbird, the remaining users didn't even have their computers on yet. Furthermore, one user seems to be getting it more often than others. He is using the most up to date Thunderbird version while others are a version or several versions behind. The user getting the login error has to use a VPN service to alter his IP address and then Thunderbird accepts the login information and he can continue to use it.

content:
Dates follow the operating system locale. It is most certainly not hard coded. Being force fed mm-DD date formats would have this Aussie firing chips at all Mozilla and Mzla employees that poked their heads up. Interestingly these types of questions most often come from Linux users where open source has led to setting a system locale being a chore and setting such details in your chosen windowing environment does not necessarily affect the system locale.

I suggest you check with your distribution how to check your locale and set it, including the date formats.

I really do not understand what your cutting and pasting of templates etc actually means. What did you do? Note if your are pasting anything into an IMAP account, especially at the file level failure is guaranteed at around 99% confidence.

content: Please give more information, such as whether this is a POP or IMAP account. If a POP account, and if account was set to delete from server after download, then they are probably lost. If an IMAP account, then nothing is lost and you would just need to reestablish the account. You can verify what files are still available by logging on to your email provider's website account. Of course, if you made a backup, we can help in recovering it. Thank you.
creator: davidsk

Once in TB I either delete or place the emails in various folders where they remain forever. I have no idea if I am POP or IMAP. I had presumed that the folders I set up and the emails I placed in those folders remained somewhere backed up in the TB "Cloud." I'm beginning to get the feeling there is no "cloud." I just tried this: https://support.mozilla.org/en-US/kb/profiles-where-thunderbird-stores-user-data?redirectslug=profiles-tb&redirectlocale=en-US#w_how-do-i-find-my-profile But I can't seem to make this work. I did not make a backup of my TB email account. I'm beginning to think emails are like phone calls. Once you hang up those conversations are gone forever.

If no backup, and account was not imap then you are out of luck, because pop accounts only have the messages on your local PC by default. As you say "Once you hang up those conversations are gone forever."

But Spectrum do support imap https://www.spectrum.net/support/internet/spectrum-email-server-settings

creator: sfhowes

content:
I will preempt this by saying I have my own personal issues with supernova. I am not an evangelist.

The first thing to consider is what software on your computer might be in a position to make a program think it has no disk space and can not open files? Everyone jumps to "malware" but in reality if you have a third party antivirus, or internet security suite, it is probably the issue.

Yes I am taking your issues out of order, but I think that that is the key issue. Repopulating something from a disk file being slow is probably related to the inability to read and write to the disk. Beyond the simplicity of the antivirus being the issue (restarting the operating system in safe mode with networking ios considered the standard diagnostic to eliminate outside influences like Av and other software like cloud sync and streaming backups which can also mimic no file access.

When it comes to folder counts of unread and total messages. Unread messages in sub folders are included in the count for their parent when collapsed as demonstrated below in a trash folder.

If you want to have a discussion about a crash, please provide the submitted crash report id so we can look at it. See https://support.mozilla.org/en-US/kb/mozilla-crash-reporter-tb#w_viewing-crash-reports
creator: MattAuSupport

content:
Thank you for your answer - though it doesn't help. All of this started when I went from release 102.15.1 to 115.5.1. Everything was working fine in 102.15.1. I have added some comments to my problems.

(1) Once again I can not click on an email link and have it open in Firefox. This has been broken in at least three of the updates in the last year and fixed in subsequent updates. Seems like they would actually try and test it each time since they keep breaking it and is something most people use.

(2) Quick filter doesn't seem to work very well any more. It might give me what I am looking for, but when I close quick filter, it starts putting back messages very slowly one at a time for minutes. This seems to be a change in the algorithm that is crazy, quite confusing, and time consuming for the user.

(3) I am getting fairly constant messages that it can't write to disk because the disk is full or it doesn't have permissions (both of which are wrong). It worked in the previous release and the only thing updated on the system was TB. Yes, I already tried a clean boot without loading anything and still ran into the problem. The other thing of note, is that it receives new messages and can compact folders without giving me this error, so it can read and write to the same disk it is complaining about. This morning it seems to have started working "automagically". Seems like there is a memory problem.

(4) I have a local sub-folder that contains 2022 emails and it has started listing some of those emails as part of the current inbox and no longer shows them as part of the 2022 sub-folder. I am not talking about record counts. I did a move-to from the inbox to the local sub-folder some months ago of email from Oct 2022 to Dec 2022, compacted the inbox and everything looked fine (i.e., no emails from Oct 2022 to Dec 2022 in the inbox). After installing 115.5.1, Oct 2022 to Dec 2022 headers (subject, correspondents, and dates) are now showing up in the inbox (along with random files from my trash) and NOT in the local 2022 sub-folder.

(5) And finally it has crashed several time. Yes - I have let the dumps be sent to development, but it seems to me that 115 is much more unstable than previous versions - which is not unusual for major changes in code. However, there should have been a bigger warning than a new version is available to install. I am like a lot of people and don't follow all the work being done on a product. I just want the product to work so I can get my work done and not have to learn what problems to work around.
creator: keduncan

content:
1. I use windows and have never in a decade actually seen the issue you describe. It seems to me that there may be more of a correlation between antivirus products in there for folk that appear to have this issue again and again. I base this on really having seen perhaps one instance of this in Linux in a decade and on apple devices only since they started installing antivirus products in the last few years.

2. I still say see the issue I mention in 1. I don't see it with 115, 120 or 102.

3. Again what gets between the software and the disk.... anti virus product first, and cloud sync and streaming backups come second.

4. Perhaps post an image showing this issue. Because clearly I do not understand. Is the account an IMAP one? There are often issues with them when they are treated like a file system and thousands of mails are moved. The update message gets lost in all the round trips to the server. Imap is meant to action perhaps a few hundred mail in an action. Not thousands. It may be that now a full sync has occured and prior failures are not showing up.

5. I still see no crash Id's for these crashes. It seems to me asking for facts does not get them. Personally I have no interest in your perceptions of stability. This is a support forum where we try and work out what it causing the problems. I am interested in why it crashed, that involves you giving me the crash id's so I can actually have a look at the data that was submitted. Probably again it will be your choice of antivirus program, or already installed malware. But I still have nothing more than supposition and guess work on which to base anything.
creator: MattAuSupport

content:
Matt -

Let me start by saying thank you for your work on the support forum.

However, I don't care that you have never seen anything like this in your decade of using windows. I have been a programmer for over 40 years, working for three computer manufacturers, developing code for applications, compilers, and operating systems on mainframes and PCs (running proprietary OSs, Windows, and a variety of Unix variants) and I have seen a lot stranger things than anything I have described in my previous post. I am also sure you don't care, but I have some free advice for you.

You seem to have a fixation with antivirus software as being the problem. I have heard this numerous times and can count on one hand how many times I have actually found the antivirus software being the problem. And as far as malware, I have scanned multiple times with different antivirus software and have found nothing.

As I have already stated, doing a clean boot and not loading any drivers gave me the same problem. As for cloud sync and streaming backups, I don't do them on the system this is failing on. If you want facts, then try and ask questions. I can spent days defining all the things that aren't on my system or aren't being done by my system.

Finally a question that I can answer. I use POP.

TB 115.5.1 has blown out of the water 3 times and only shows one dump even though I said to go ahead and send all 3. I haven't given dump info, because I am not as worried about a crash (since none of the problems I described before resulted in a crash), as I am about it l doing crazy things like moving data where I don't want it.

Dumps are easy - until you start working with parallel processes interacting. The "crazy" things that happen and don't give you dumps are the hard ones. Want to have some fun - try debugging propriety code that you can't get all the source for, running as one program across 24 processors and only fails by giving the wrong result once every 100,000 runs or so.

So you don't care about user perceptions. I think you might want to reconsider. User perceptions are their reality. If a product can't be trusted, then you loose users, which is great if you don't want a product to survive.

And here is another piece to the puzzle. Compacting the mail folders seems to have caused my problems to go away - which I thought was only reclaiming disk space. My guess is there are some memory problems in the new code.
creator: keduncan

content: I agree with Matt, and I suggest you take the wisdom of his advice.
creator: wsmwk

content:
Wayne -

So your choices for the problem are that it is malware or a virus scanner.

I have proved to my satisfaction that it is not the virus scanner - first by turning it off and then totally removing it and all the files associated with it.

As for proving it is not malware, that is impossible. I can prove that a half-dozen different virus scanners do not find anything on my system. That doesn't mean that there isn't malware on my system. It only proves that they don't find it.

I do have a question though. Which is more probable: (1) that somehow malware downloaded onto my system and can't be found by the best virus scanners we have at the same time that I downloaded TB 115.5.1 (or only activated when it saw TB 115.5.1), is only causing random email problems, and having no affect on any other files on my system OR (2) the new code in TB 115.5.1 is buggy and causing the problem.

If you really believe that (1) is more probable, what exactly would you suggest?

I could reformat and do a clean install of Windows, but as soon as it is connected to the internet for updates you can claim malware has infected the system. I could keep it off the internet, but then I couldn't use TB for email - which sort of defeats the whole purpose of having an email program.

I have an idea. why don't you prove that the product doesn't have bugs. It would definitely be a more effective use of my time.
creator: keduncan

content:
Your initial choice here is to put some level of trust in roughly (I estimate) a combined 30 years of experience supporting Thunderbird, or not and wait for some version of Thunderbird in future years which may or may not solve your problem. Our initial perspective of experience, plus the *combination* of items you wrote in your initial post, strongly suggests that something on your PC is affecting Thunderbird. And the probability increases when you are on Windows.

No one is saying there is no possibility of bugs in Thunderbird, or that these recommendations will help everything you cited, but it would be a solid starting point. And some if it is dead easy.

> (1) Quick filter doesn't seem to work very well any more. It might give me what I am looking for, but when I close it quick filter, it starts putting back messages very slowly one at a time for minutes.

How many messages in the folder? And apparently you can easily reproduce this - so does it happen with Windows started in safe mode and Thunderbird started in Troubleshoot Mode?

> (3) I am getting fairly constant messages that it can't write to disk because the disk is full or it doesn't have permissions (both of which are wrong). > (4) I have a sub-folder that contains 2022 emails and it has started listing those emails as part of the current inbox and no longer shows them as part of the 2022 sub-folder.

Screen shots please for both.


> (5) And finally it has crashed several time.

Please post your crash IDs here. Instructions at https://support.mozilla.org/en-US/kb/mozilla-crash-reporter-tb
creator: wsmwk

content:
Wayne -

I don't discount your knowledge or experience. I am only a user of the product. However, I have been using it since it was a product you paid for and this is the first time I have seen so many problems. There have been minor problems that I have ignored or worked around over the years, but overall it has held up very well.

This time it is doing a number of incredibly weird things - and worse, it is losing data. I am not arrogant enough to challenge you and have jumped through the hoops the last couple of days, doing reboots, removing my virus scanner, scanning for phantom malware, etc. only to be told that it has to be the virus scanner. That I am arrogant enough to say BS to.

As for the problems I listed: (1) email links not being clickable - it seems to be sporadic, working and not working depending on the invocation of email (2) quick filter - other people seem to be having the problem as well (3) disk errors - problem has gone away by itself - which makes me feel like it is a memory issue (overflowing a buffer or not initializing something) - seems to have completely cleared when I compacted a the inbox (4) messages showing up in the wrong folder - a screen shot isn't going to help because all it is going to show is that the files are now in the inbox and I have no "proof" that I ever moved them - unless I do a restore since it was backuped - and I am not going to do that. I moved about 25,000 emails from the inbox to a local sub-folder 2022 in July using a move-to command and everything was fine. Started using TB 115 and now those emails are showing up in the inbox and not in the sub-folder. At the same time random emails that were deleted and in my trash randomly started coming out of the trash and again appearing in the inbox. This problem seems to have stopped after I compacted the inbox again - though I did compact it after the first moveto in July. (5) As I said before only one dump seems to have been sent (of three) and while this interchange has been "entertaining", I am not worried about the problem. At this point I am more concerned about data being lost - which isn't being addressed. Yesterday, I lost all the files in my sent mail folder and it now shows that there are 2 unread messages - even though going to the folder shows nothing.

So here is my suggestion on how to proceed. Give me a pointer to how to back out 115 and go back to my previous version. - so that I can stop the damage from continuing. Or better yet, give me a pointer on how to keep my data files and reinstall an old version (not 115 based) from scratch and move the data files over on the same system. That way I can make sure that 115 is really gone and make sure that I have a clean starting point (since I have been doing updates of TB for the last 5 years on this machine).

In a couple of months when I finish with a couple of other problems I am having on a different system (i.e., being forced to Windows 11 even though I said not to update it), I will be getting a new system and will start by installing a clean new version of 115 on it and we can go from there.
creator: keduncan
